text: This is a list of the busiest airports in Southeast Asia, ranked and broken down by its total passengers per year, which includes arrival, departure, and transit passengers. Note that airports in Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, and Brunei are hardly mentioned here due to either the lack of statistics, non-existent data for 2016 statistics, or for its lack of passenger numbers; too little to make it into this list. == 2017 statistics == Airports Council International's full-year figures are as follows: {|class="wikitable sortable" style="font- size: 85%" width= align= |- style="background:lightgrey;" !Rank||Airport||City||Country||Code (IATA/ICAO)||Total passengers||% Change |- |1|| Soekarno–Hatta International Airport||Jakarta|| Indonesia||CGK/WIII||63,015,620||8.0% |- |2|| Singapore Changi Airport||Singapore||Singapore||SIN/WSSS||62,219,573 ||6.0% |- |3|| Suvarnabhumi Airport||Bangkok/Samut Prakan||Thailand||BKK/VTBS||60,860,704 ||8.9% |- |4|| Kuala Lumpur International Airport||Kuala Lumpur|| Malaysia||KUL/WMKK||58,618,680Malaysia Airports Holdings Berhad.
